author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Airlines cancel all Saturday flights to and from Bali due to volcanic ash - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Airlines cancel all Saturday flights to and from Bali due to volcanic ash
Volcanic ash in the vicinity of Bali’s Denpasar Airport is resulting in continuous flight delays and cancellation. Bali holidaymakers continue to face delays with airlines cancelling flights for the fourth consecutive day on Saturday.
Virgin and Jetstar have announced the cancellation of all Saturday flights to and from Bali. Jetstar announced its next scheduled flight to be on 15:35pm on Saturday after monitoring the visibility conditions.
Jetstar said it would inform passengers on Saturday morning regarding the next flight after receiving advice from the Volcanic Ash Advisory Centre.
Virgin said those passengers scheduled to travel to Denpasar had the option of switching their destination free of charge to one of the 12 destinations, including Port Vila on Vanuatu, Nadi in Fiji and the Gold Coast in Queensland.
Virgin Australia flights cancelled for Saturday August 8 are:
VA55 PERDPS – 0700L
VA49 MELDPS – 0905L
VA41 BNEDPS – 1005L
VA65 SYDDPS – 1115L
VA74 DPSPHE – 1135L
VA73 PHEDPS – 1535L

VA69 SYDDPS – 1830L
VA62 DPSPER – 2110L
VA46 DPSBNE – 2210L
VA54 DPSMEL – 2210L
VA64 DPSSYD – 0020L
VA40 DPSBNE – 0110L

JQ44 – Bali-Melbourne
JQ47 – Brisbane – Bali
JQ83 – Darwin- Bali

JQ107 — Bali – Perth
JQ109 – Bali-Perth
